Game.VesselModels

Class Vessel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.VesselModels.Vessel

  • public class Vessel
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a Vessel- the real form to the schematic's platonic form Created by IkeAlmighty on 9/21/2016, with love and small amounts of care.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vessel

        public Vessel(Schematic schematic,
              java.lang.String name,
              Physics physicsModule)
        Creates a new Vessel based on a schematic and physics module. Could possibly add more physics modules to the vessel...?
        Parameters:
        schematic - A schematic object (Contains player made instructions for the vessel to follow in game).
        name - the name of the vessel in game. Would be cool if this was user chosen.
        physicsModule - A module for physics rules this object follows.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - New name of the vessel.

      • attach

        public void attach(Part part)
        Parameters:
        part - A part for the vessel. Part is abstract, so really one of its subclasses.

      • drawVessel

        public void drawVessel()
        This method should draw the vessel, which is comprised of many discrete sprites. It should draw all of the base blocks, each individual sprites, which are octogons, and then draw all of the finning (connecting corners) behind those sprites.

      • drawBaseBlocks

        private void drawBaseBlocks()
        Helper method for drawVessel

      • drawFinning

        private void drawFinning()
        Helper method for drawVessel

      • getAnchorPoints

        private AnchorPoint[] getAnchorPoints(java.util.ArrayList<Part> blocks)
        Helper method of drawFinning. Note: An "Anchor Point" is each corner of a Base Block. It is from these that "finning", or the connecting of corners, occurs.
        Parameters:
        blocks - an array of Part objects
        Returns:
        A new array of AnchorPoint objects, on a grid w scale 1/4 the pointSize of the grid block locations are base off of. Array represents the locations of all anchor points of base blocks. Each anchor point also has a reference to its "parent" block.
